body:
So basically, I need a decent laptop for my school work, that I can actually take to school without having to have a pickup truck... I'll do normal/intense tasks such as working on music producing, programming, editing, light gaming, actual school work, etc.  I never really actually used a laptop for the past like 2 years, and I cannot be bothered to go out and research all the laptops that are out there.

So if you have any suggestions please let me know, and if possible achieve these requirements:

- Budget: ~$600-800
- Windows 8.1 / 7 (Maybe 10)
- Either an i5 or i7 (6th gen preferably) would do.
- No graphics card really needed, but if there is one that's fine.
- 12-16GB of Memory
- Have a nice display (15 inch [38.1 cm] or more)
- At least 2 USB 3.0 and maybe 1 USB 2.0
- Decent keyboard, honestly It doesn't really matter.
- Should be able to run FL Studio 12, Eclipse, Adobe After Effects, and light games.

Thanks! :)

Don't need a GPU dock
I just need a PC that can run the applications decently.
And I kind of want it fast... I need to do a few projects in class, but I honestly can't stand the macs that we have...
(Also, I'm so restricted to those macs, it's impossible to do anything on them, with a laptop I can have everything and anything i need.)
Again, I don't want to haul around 3 tons worth of technology in my backpack.
An i5 will do the job and I don't need that good of a graphics card, Actually I don't need it, since I'll only be playing games like osu! or chess, idk.
